STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 15, 2024
Tanual Gaskew
House of Love Agency
720 South Michigan Ave.,
Saginaw, MI, 48602
Re: License #: CI730404189
SIR#: 2024C0000927SI
Dear Tanual Gaskew:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI730404189
Licensee Group Organization: House of Love Agency
Licensee Designee: Arneeshia Tamerra Brewer
Chief Administrator: Tanual Gaskew
Agency Name: House of Love Agency
Agency Address: 720 South Michigan Ave.
Saginaw, MI 48602
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 12/23/2025
Capacity: 16
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
11/17/2023 On-site Special Investigation Initiation
11/17/2023 Face to Face Interview
11/17/2023 Phone Other
11/21/2023 Phone Interview - complainant
12/5/2023 Phone Interview
12/6/2023 Email Other
01/31/2024 Phone Interview of CA
01/31/2024 Email Notification
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth had a Chromebook that they were not supposed to have. It
was reported that youth was pinned to her bed by a staff member
in attempt to restrain her.
Investigation Interviews:
On 11/17/2023 an onsite visit was completed at House of Love
Agency (HOLA) and Special Investigation was initiated. An in-
person visit was held with Youth A. She confirmed that she had a
chrome book in her possession and had it in her bedroom. She
reported Staff 1 came upstairs to her room and requested that she
provide her the Chromebook as she was not supposed to have it
in her room. Youth A confirmed she refused to provide it and
began a verbal altercation with Staff 1. She reported Staff 1
“pinned her down on the bed” and took the Chromebook. Youth A
did not provide further detail about “how” she was “pinned” down
on the bed. She reported she had scratches on her arm from the
incident. She further admitted that she became very upset and
was verbally and physically aggressive toward Staff 1. She
confirmed she hit Staff 1 and the police were contacted. Youth A
reported she did not tell the police that she was pinned to the bed
when they came to the house. She did not provide information as
to why she failed to inform law enforcement. She further
confirmed she did not tell any of the other staff in the house. She
reported she told the Chief administrator (CA), however reported
that CA asked her “what did you do?”. Youth A reported that CA
acted as if staff had responded in the appropriate way. Youth A
also reported that Youth B, Youth C, Staff 1 and Supervisor 1
were upstairs at some point during the incident.
On 11/17/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Youth B at
HOLA. She confirmed she was present the day of the incident
and witnessed Staff 1 yelling at Youth A. She reported Staff 1
was yelling “get out of my face” and yelling “you’re in my space” to
Youth A. Youth B further reported she saw Staff 1 holding down
Youth A on the bed. Youth B denied knowledge of any other staff
present. She did recall that Youth C was present and witnessed
the bed hold also. She reported that Youth C ran from the
program and is currently Absent Without Official Leave (AWOL)
and has not returned to the facility.
2

On 11/17/2023 a phone call was held with Program Manager
(PM). She was advised of the allegations associated with the
investigation. She recalled the day of the incident, confirmed that
she was present and also indicated that law enforcement (LE) was
contacted due to the aggressive behavior of Youth A and her
assault of Staff 1. PM recalled that no charges were pressed
against Youth A and she was allowed to remain in the program.
On 11/17/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 1 at
HOLA. She is a direct care worker and reported that she normally
works afternoon and midnight shifts. Staff 1 also confirmed that
she was present at HOLA on the day of the incident. Staff 1
reported that Youth A went to her room early and this was out of
character for her. Staff 1 went upstairs to check on Youth A and
stated she heard the chrome book close. She reports that she
discussed it with Supervisor 1 and a decision was made to obtain
the chrome book and store it in the office. She reported that she
asked Youth A for the chrome book and she refused to provide it.
She further reported that Youth A became escalated and was
yelling and screaming at her. She reported that Youth A was not
responding to her attempts to redirect and deescalate her. Staff 1
denied that she held or pinned Youth A down on the bed in an
attempt to obtain the chrome book. She stated that Youth A
continued to yell in her face and she stated that she told Youth A
to “get out of her face”. She also reported that Youth A ended up
hitting her and law enforcement was contacted. Staff 1 indicated
that it is the agency policy not to restrain youth in the program.
On 11/21/2023 a phone conversation was held with the
complainant. No additional concerns were noted.
On 12/05/2023 a follow-up phone conversation was held with PM.
She advised that the agency did not have copies of the police
report and informed of the process that had been used to obtain
copies of the report.
On 12/05/2023 a phone interview was held with Supervisor 1. She
confirmed she has been employed with the agency since August
2023 as a supervisor. Supervisor 1 recalled that Youth A, Youth
B, Youth C, herself and Staff 1 were present when the incident
occurred. Supervisor 1 recalled Staff 1 went upstairs to get the
Chromebook from Youth A and she later heard lots of screaming
coming from upstairs. Supervisor 1 stated she then went upstairs.
She stated went she got upstairs, Staff 1 had possession of the
Chromebook and Youth A was trying to take it from her. She
recalled that Youth A was yelling “this is my shit” and “yall can’t
3

take my shit”. Youth A was encouraged to relax and calm down
but refused. Supervisor 1 stated she contacted the police
because of Youth A’s behavior. She confirmed that Youth A was
being aggressive. She further stated Staff 1 was telling Youth A to
“get out of my face” and “you’re in my space”, but she was not
yelling. Supervisor 1 denied observing Staff 1 pinning down Youth
A. She denied seeing any marks or bruises on any of the youth
and denied that Youth A had advised her that staff had harmed
her.
On 12/06/2023 a email correspondence was received from child
welfare staff confirming that Youth C remained AWOL.
On 01/31/2024 a telephone interview was held with Chief
Administrator (CA). CA reports that she was not present at the
house when the incident occurred and arrived on site at the same
time as the police. She denies that Youth A advised her that she
had been “pinned down” by staff. She recalls that her time on site
was spent attempting to deescalate Youth A. She stated that
Youth A confirmed to her that she refused to give the chrome
book to staff. CA reported that she asked Youth A “what she
could have done differently?”. CA denied that she asked Youth A
“what did you do?” CA also reported that she does not recall if
Staff 1 or Supervisor 1 reported that Youth A had been held or
pinned down.
On 01/31/2024 an email correspondence was sent to assigned
DHHS specialist of Youth A to advise of investigation.
The following documents were reviewed as a part of the
investigation:
Face sheets and/or Youth Intake forms for Youth A, Youth B
and Youth C.
HOLA incident report for incident that took place on
11/11/2023T – IR is written and signed by Staff 1. The report did
not reference any youth being “pinned” to the bed. It actually
documented that Youth A became upset and started “pushing and
hitting on staff trying to get the tablet”. It further documented that
no care was given and no first aid was administered.
Saginaw State Police Report for Case No. 2371706664 – The
report documented that LE was dispatched to HOLA to obtain a
report regarding an assault. The report indicated Staff 1 and
Supervisor 1 reported they had been assaulted by Youth A. Staff
4

1 reported Youth A “started swinging” at her and tried to grab the
Chrome Book. She also stated that Youth A came downstairs and
“tried to push” her in order to get into the office to retrieve her
Chrome Book. Supervisor 1 reported during the incident, Youth A
refused to go back upstairs and “shoved” her when trying to get
into the office to ger her Chrome Book. The report had no
documentation of injuries to Youth A, nor any report that she had
been “assaulted” or “pinned down” by staff. The report referenced
an interview of Youth A, but it was not included in the report.
Requests for any additional information relative to the incident
have resulted in no further LE documentation.
Employee HR File of Staff 1 – Staff 1 was hired on 8/7/23 as a
part time employee and transitioned to full time on 9/4/23. She
received a written notice of discipline and coaching on 12/14/2023
for disruptive activity (oversharing of personal information). No
other disciplinary action was noted in the HR file. Staff 1 was
terminated from HOLA effective 1/03/2024 as a result of not
calling and/or not showing for schedule day of employment and
breach of code of ethics.
Analysis After the conclusion of the investigation, there was sufficient
evidence to support non-compliance with licensing rule 4158-1-a-
ii. Although the staff denied the allegations, two youth were
interviewed, and both reported that the staff grabbed Youth A and
pinned her down to the bed in an attempt to take the chrome book
from her. Review of the police report did not document injuries to
Youth A, nor did it document her report of being “pinned down” by
staff. However, during the interview of Youth A, she reported that
she did not report the actions of the staff to LE.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
01/08/2024
______________________________________________________________________
Cassandra Thomas Date
5

Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
2/15/2024
